struct local_info;
}}

The class {{tt|local_info}} describes the result of converting a {{lc|std::chrono::local_time}} to a {{lc|std::chrono::sys_time}}.

* If the result of the conversion is unique, then {{c|1=result == local_info::unique}}, {{tt|first}} is filled out with the correct {{lc|std::chrono::sys_info}}, and {{tt|second}} is zero-initialized.
* If the {{tt|local_time}} is nonexistent, then {{c|1=result == local_info::nonexistent}}, {{tt|first}} is filled out with the {{lc|std::chrono::sys_info}} that ends just prior to the {{tt|local_time}}, and {{tt|second}} is filled out with the {{lc|std::chrono::sys_info}} that begins just after the {{tt|local_time}}.
* If the {{tt|local_time}} is ambiguous, then {{c|1=result == local_info::ambiguous}}, {{tt|first}} is filled out with the {{lc|std::chrono::sys_info}} that ends just after the {{tt|local_time}}, and {{tt|second}} is filled with the {{lc|std::chrono::sys_info}} that starts just before the {{tt|local_time}}.

This is a low-level data structure; typical conversions from {{tt|local_time}} to {{tt|sys_time}} will use it implicitly rather than explicitly.
